Understanding Modern Web Scraping Techniques

By Jane Developer | January 15, 2026

Web scraping has evolved significantly over the past decade. Modern approaches combine multiple strategies to handle the diversity of web technologies in use today.

The Three-Tier Approach

A robust scraping system typically employs a tiered fallback strategy:

  1. RSS/Atom Feeds - The fastest and most reliable method when available. Structured data requires minimal parsing.
  2. Static HTML Parsing - Using tools like Cheerio and Readability to extract content from server-rendered pages.
  3. Headless Browser Rendering - For single-page applications that require JavaScript execution to render content.

Content Extraction

Mozilla's Readability library excels at identifying the main content of a page, stripping away navigation, sidebars, ads, and other non-essential elements. It analyzes the DOM structure and applies heuristics to find the article body.

This technique works remarkably well for blog posts, news articles, and other long-form content. The extracted text is clean and ready for further processing, such as AI-powered summarization or classification.

Conclusion

By combining these approaches with proper concurrency control and error handling, developers can build reliable content aggregation systems that handle the full spectrum of web technologies.
